summary.para: The TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS enumeration contains values that specify the type of information being assigned to or retrieved from an access token.
The function uses these values to indicate the type of token information to retrieve.
The function uses these values to set the token information.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenUser
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains the user account of the token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenGroups
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains the group accounts associated with the token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenPrivileges
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains the privileges of the token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenOwner
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains the default owner security identifier (SID) for newly created objects.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenPrimaryGroup
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains the default primary group SID for newly created objects.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenDefaultDacl
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains the default DACL for newly created objects.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenSource
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains the source of the token. TOKEN_QUERY_SOURCE access is needed to retrieve this information.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenType
member.summary: The buffer receives a value that indicates whether the token is a primary or impersonation token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenImpersonationLevel
member.summary: The buffer receives a value that indicates the impersonation level of the token. If the access token is not an impersonation token, the function fails.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenStatistics
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains various token statistics.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenRestrictedSids
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains the list of restricting SIDs in arestricted token.

summary.para: The buffer receives a DWORD value that indicates the Terminal Services session identifier that is associated with the token.
If the token is associated with the terminal server client session, the session identifier is nonzero.
Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: If the token is associated with the terminal server console session, the session identifier is zero.
In a non-Terminal Services environment, the session identifier is zero.
If TokenSessionId is set with , the application must have the Act As Part Of the Operating System privilege, and the application must be enabled to set the session ID in a token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenGroupsAndPrivileges
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains the user SID, the group accounts, the restricted SIDs, and the authentication ID associated with the token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenSessionReference
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenSandBoxInert
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if the token includes the SANDBOX_INERT flag.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenAuditPolicy
member.summary: Reserved.

summary.para: If the token resulted from a logon that used explicit credentials, such as passing a name, domain, and password to the function, then the structure will contain the ID of the logon session that created it.
If the token resulted from network authentication, such as a call to or a call to with dwLogonType set to LOGON32_LOGON_NETWORK or LOGON32_LOGON_NETWORK_CLEARTEXT, then this value will be zero.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenElevationType
member.summary: The buffer receives a value that specifies the elevation level of the token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenLinkedToken
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains a handle to another token that is linked to this token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenElevation
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that specifies whether the token is elevated.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenHasRestrictions
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if the token has ever been filtered.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenAccessInformation
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that specifies security information contained in the token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenVirtualizationAllowed
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if virtualization is allowed for the token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenVirtualizationEnabled
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if virtualization is enabled for the token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenIntegrityLevel
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that specifies the token's integrity level.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenUIAccess
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if the token has the UIAccess flag set.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenMandatoryPolicy
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that specifies the token's mandatory integrity policy.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenLogonSid
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that specifies the token's logon SID.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenIsAppContainer
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if the token is an app container token. Any callers who check the TokenIsAppContainer and have it return 0 should also verify that the caller token is not an identify level impersonation token. If the current token is not an app container but is an identity level token, you should return AccessDenied.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenCapabilities
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains the capabilities associated with the token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenAppContainerSid
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains the AppContainerSid associated with the token. If the token is not associated with an app container, the TokenAppContainer member of the TOKEN_APPCONTAINER_INFORMATION structure points to NULL.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenAppContainerNumber
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that includes the app container number for the token. For tokens that are not app container tokens, this value is zero.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenUserClaimAttributes
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains the user claims associated with the token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenDeviceClaimAttributes
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains the device claims associated with the token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenRestrictedUserClaimAttributes
member.summary: This value is reserved.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenRestrictedDeviceClaimAttributes
member.summary: This value is reserved.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenDeviceGroups
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains the device groups that are associated with the token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenRestrictedDeviceGroups
member.summary: The buffer receives a structure that contains the restricted device groups that are associated with the token.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenSecurityAttributes
member.summary: This value is reserved.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenIsRestricted
member.summary: This value is reserved.

member.name: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.MaxTokenInfoClass
member.summary: The maximum value for this enumeration.
